attributes.action: Require companies to tell applicants the status of their job application.
attributes.background: Applicants should have a right to receive a reply from employers. This petition isn’t to push for critical feedback, but a simple “yes, you have a job” or “no, you haven’t." Failure to reply within a reasonable time-frame should be punished by fines, depending on the company's size.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple reply from an employer can help better a person's options. People seeking work explore and apply for various types of employment, unskilled jobs, career and training programs or apprenticeships; and often, many of these jobs would start around the same time. Some options may be better than others depending on the individual, and a simple reply of “yes”, “no” or “still being reviewed” can improve a person on making a better choice financially or for their lifestyle.

Placing an applicant in a state of suspense and stress, sometimes for months when it comes to programs and apprenticeships is a cruel situation to place anyone in, when a feedback about the application will allow an applicant to move on and accept other options.

attributes.action: Change ‘national speed limit’ signs so they show the actual speed for that road
attributes.background: The current National speed limit signs are confusing for most drivers on our roads. If the signs were to display an actual speed limit for any given road this would take away any uncertainty.

attributes.action: Request intervention in Myanmar at the Security Council against genocide
attributes.background: soldiers in Myanmar have committed genocide according to the United Nations . Amnesty International has also found evidence including forensic medical evidence, corroborated witness testimony and satellite imagery of crimes against humanity.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/uk.mobile.reuters.com/article/amp/idUKKCN1GJ167
https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/06/atrocities-against-the-rohingya-how-we-built-the-case-to-implicate-myanmar-military-officials-in-crimes-against-humanity/

attributes.action: Explain how Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources are used & kept safe.
attributes.background:
It was recently reported that the government use what they describe as Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (otherwise known as children) are used in intelligence services. 

If a government is willing to put children at risk the public deserve to know why, when and how they are kept safe.

attributes.action: Hot weather payment to stay cool
attributes.background: Emergency payment for those in need to keep cool in such extreme heat
attributes.additional_details: Cold weather payments are made so people don't die of cold but a person can die of heat stroke just as much

attributes.action: Make Jordan Pickford’s birthday (March 7th) a national holiday
attributes.background: Jordan Pickford has been England’s Number 1 goalkeeper at the 2018 World Cup and he has been brilliant. Jordan Pickford’s birthday should be a national holiday to celebrate his performances at the 2018 World Cup.

attributes.action: Better Mental Health Services for Autistic Individuals.
attributes.background: Better Mental Health Services are needed for Autistic Individuals. It is important to have the right mental health services for autistic teenagers and adults to help with the stresses and strains of mental health as well as daily life. There are not enough services specific for those with an ASC.

attributes.action: Exempt all childcare for children and young people with disabilities
attributes.background: Parents and carers are required to pay VAT 20% on top of their childcare, which puts families in financial difficulties. This will reflect negatively on the family and child’s welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Child care for children and young people should be counted as a Disability service and be made Tax-Free.

attributes.action: Set up law to exempt spouse and parents of those KIA from council tax for life
attributes.background:
There is no law at present which exempts spouse and parents of those members of the armed forces, security services, NHS and police killed during their service or when on operations. 
To honour them, I want UK legislation to excuse their spouse and parents from council tax liability for life

attributes.action: Change restrictions on legal aid so that everyone can have 1 free appeal
attributes.background: Legal aid has strict criteria making it difficult unless on benefits to get free representation when convicted of a crime. The criteria should be changed allowing anyone the right to have legal aid for the appeal process regardless of people earnings.
attributes.additional_details: People that are wrongfully convicted have no chance of appeal unless they pay for representation and this can be an average cost of £5000. Most people in the United Kingdom are denied the chance due to criteria. If household income is less than £40,000 a year people should have the right to legal aid and appeals

attributes.action: Introduce Online Sales Tax to fund NHS spending increase
attributes.background:
The Government has "gifted" the NHS an extra £20bn of our money, proposed through raising yet more tax on middle and higher income earners!

An Online Sales Tax directed against Google, Amazon, eBay, Twitter etc should be used to offset tax rises for stretched families and save our high street.
attributes.additional_details:
Amazon and Google both generated £7bn in sales revenue in 2017.  A new OST of 12% (on top of VAT) would generate £1.8bn per annum alone.  Facebook did £850m in sales, generating another £100m OST for the pot.

Middle and higher income earners are not a limitless well of money for the Government to keep dipping into.  The top 1% of income earners already pay more than 28% of all income tax.  This is unsustainable in the long term and we need to reduce taxes & seek efficiency savings.

attributes.action: Recall of UK ambassador to the US in protest about detaining children in cages.
attributes.background: The United States government has implemented a policy on 06/04/2018 to separate and detain children of asylum seekers entering the US. This is an illegal and inhuman act. By withdrawing (recalling) the UK's ambassador to the US this send a strong an clear message that this is not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Since June 2018 US Customs and Border Portection have been forcibly removing children from their parents, people claiming asylum. These children have and are being detained in centres little more than cages and tented cities. The children are numbered and tagged. The US government has now opened 'Tender Age Shelters' to house babies and infants. See:

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/rachel-maddow-cries-tender-age-shelters-video-us-migrant-children-separated-parents-a8407436.html

attributes.action: Provide clarity around the powers & legislation of bailiffs & civil enforcement
attributes.background: Civil enforcement agencies and bailiffs are a private entity which are used to recover debt. There have been a large number of cases where these enforcement agents are providing misleading information occupiers at properties which generally leaves no choice but to make payments in full.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to this lack of clarity police are called to such instances around 89% of times, wasting police time as they can not enforce anything except ensure there is no breach in peace as the matter is of a civil nature. 

If warrants had stated thereon the powers of entry a bailiff or enforcement may have according to the type of warrant they are present to execute, this would be beneficial all parties including the police as they generally have no knowledge about the rights of these agents

attributes.action: Introduce retail transaction tax and abolish retailers’ business rates
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  This disproportionate cost is contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% retail business rate tax on each sales transaction value rather than property space would be a fairer arrangement and would be directly linked to the business’s success rather than the cause of its failure. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place. The credit card holder’s physical location (in-store) or credit card address (online) are readily available for re-allocation to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Stop Water companies from draining UK taxable profits by ‘Earnings Stripping’
attributes.background: Utilities companies’ taxable profits are being drained by large foreign-owned multinationals. The profits subsidise their global monopolization and enrich the 1% high wealth investors. Government’s tax revenue destined for health and welfare is being permanently lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Multinationals reduce their taxable profits by deducting interest payments on loans held by another subsidiary located in a low tax jurisdiction.
 
The Government should change tax regulation to prevent this and should: 
-disallow for tax purposes the company’s interest expense on non-infrastructure borrowings and cap annual deduction to 1% of turnover; 
-disallow all non-UK intragroup recharges from subsidiaries/related parties above 5% of turnover.

attributes.action: Change GCSE's Grades From 9-1 to 1-9
attributes.background: Most people get confused with the new GCSE's grading system and personally i do not like it.

attributes.action: Remove home address from UK Driving Licence.
attributes.background: Most people carry their driving licence and house keys together.  Having your home address on the licence is unnecessary as all information will be attached to the licence number.  It's time to end this potentially dangerous practice.

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: UK adopt a Norway style Brexit. Being in the EFTA-EEA. No jurisdiction for UK.
attributes.background:
The Norway model includes two European organizations.The European Free Trade Association(EFTA) and European Economic Area (EEA)
UK would leave the EU, join EFTA, and become a full member of the EEA.
attributes.additional_details:
Most research suggests this would be the least damaging form of Brexit. The government's own impact assessment found the Norway option would be the least damaging option in terms of economic harm. 
Britain would retain full single market access,it wouldn't be forced to sign up to some of the EU's more contentious policies.
During the 2016 referendum Scotland, Northern Ireland and Gibraltar voted to remain. 
This is the most fair outcome as the UK is still leaving the EU yet keeping access.

attributes.action: Strengthen workers' rights to tackle in-work poverty.
attributes.background:
The Government should implement the following improvements to workers' rights:
•	A minimum wage of £10 for all workers
•	A minimum contract of 16 hours per week for everyone who wants it
•	A contract based on an individual’s normal hours of work
•	A ban on zero hours contracts

attributes.action: I’m asking for mindfulness and self love taught compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: The mental health and crime rates are at a controllable level if you actively put in place the right solution. Mindfulness meditation and self love and appreciation of others should be taught compulsory in schools as this could mean the difference for our next generation. This can only be positive.
attributes.additional_details: We are moving in to a time where children are struggling with self love, love of others and the ability to handle emotions, not being able to handle emotions results in dissociating with them, this is why most children and adult are currently suffering. We need to teach children how to love one another for internal attributes and ensure meditation in the morning so they are ready for their day. Children work harder than we think and deserve the right care, they rest their bodies what about minds

attributes.action: Force rail companies to freeze rail fares for at least 5 years.
attributes.background: The new rise in rail fares is criminal and only lining the pockets of the wealthy running the trains in Britain. We demand that the rail fares be frozen so that people are not being stripped of their cash and being made poorer just to get to work.

attributes.action: Grant British citizenship after 8 years of marriage to a British Citizen
attributes.background: There have been cases of British citizens being blackmailed, bullied and forced into marriage to obtain British Citizenship. Stronger laws should be placed to stop sham marriages.
attributes.additional_details: British citizenship should only be granted to foreign nationals after 8 years of being together. A temporary British passport can be granted however, the temporary British passport could be terminated if separation takes place before 8 years.

attributes.action: Reform GDPR/Data Law with Automatic Fines on Bodies/Organisations not Complying
attributes.background: Since the GDPR was updated in May 2018 some public bodies/organisations still do not comply. Reform GDPR/Data Law to impose Automatic Daily Fines for failure to respond/comply with a data request within 1 month. If any records are withhold an automatic fine of the ICO maximum of £500,000 must apply
attributes.additional_details: If public bodies/organisations wish to recover some of the costs of the fines they will have to appeal to court to prove which information is being withheld/concealed from individuals & why, how the information was gathered & generated or records contaminated. If proven there is an attempt to obstruct justice those involved should be ordered to pay towards the fine/costs. We must have accountability across our public services, every individual in the UK is entitled to access to all their records

attributes.action: Make it non-compulsory for students to pay for a tv license
attributes.background: If students can prove that a tv license has been paid for at their home address there should be no need to pay for a license at their student accommodation.
attributes.additional_details: Currently students do not have to pay council tax at student accommodation, this should also apply for tv license.

attributes.action: Ban Helium in party balloons.
attributes.background: Helium is used to inflate party balloons. We believe that helium, as a finite resource, should be used exclusively for essential needs such as medial purposes. Party balloons can be used with air to create great displays. Parts of Norway have banned helium for balloons and the UK should follow.
attributes.additional_details:
Norway helium ban
https://www.plasticsoupfoundation.org/en/2018/05/norway-bans-helium-balloons/

Alternative ways to display balloons without using helium
https://www.getpersonalised.net/personalised-balloons/displaying-number-balloons-with-air-lets-stop-the-helium/

attributes.action: Make it law for all road users who do not indicate when turning, to pay a fine.
attributes.background:
I'm getting sick & tired of inconsiderate road users, whether they are operating a car, van, truck, motorcycle or bicycle. 
How many times have you sat at a busy junction & thought "if only this car wasn't coming across my path, I'd be able to get across". Only for them to turn without indicating!

attributes.action: Create provision in law for Overtime Payments & max normal hours to be 40/week!
attributes.background: In current Law there is no provision for maximum working week i.e. what hours an employee must work on normal basis and there is no provision for overtime payments. Working over for free IS EXPLOITATION. and we, the working people who are your employers do deserve payment for worked hours!
attributes.additional_details:
Please set the following in the Employment Law: 
- max contractual normal working hours to be 40 hours per week 
 and anything above and over 40hours/week to be considered overtime 
- make an explicit provision in law that any overtime must be paid for 
 and minimum rates shall be: 
 - 1.33x or above for overtime worked on a normal working day 
 - 1.50x or above for overtime worked on Saturday 
 - 2.00x or above for overtime worked on Sunday or Public/Bank Holiday 
Working for Free is EXPLOITATION

attributes.action: Make payment from nett income for residential care tax deductible for over 70's
attributes.background: The cost of residential and social care is extremely high. My Mother is 90 years old and has been in a residential home for three years. Her total income does not fully meet her monthly care charges. To alleviate the problem introduce a tax concession on bona fide care costs for those who pay.
attributes.additional_details: It would be a positive gesture from Government to recognise those who have made honest declarations and are subsequently burdened further by the tax system. The Government should also recognise that payments on account for current tax years are also onerous on meeting care costs and should be addressed. The Government should recognise that most people over the age of 70 are not on PAYE and the tax coding system is unreasonable for that population when in care.

attributes.action: Abolish married couple's allowance and marriage allowance
attributes.background: This legislation is outdated and discriminatory. It discriminates against asexuals and aromatics. It is also sexist as for those on married couple's allowance (who married before December 2005), the break is based in the husband's income regardless of who actually earns the most.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this law to be in breach of the Equality Act 2010 as it discriminates on the basis of sexuality and (in the case of the married couple's allowance) gender. I believe this to be archaic and not at all fitting with the present times - married people are not any poorer than cohabiting or single people. So why should they be taxed less? Why do we still have a law that is based on the husband's income? It's 2018 isn't it?

attributes.action: Sanitary products must become free of charge to all young women 18 or under.
attributes.background: Girls and young women are struggling to buy sanitary products for themselves which leaves them a unpleasant experience during their period. There are many young women living in poverty who can't provide for themselves so receiving free sanitary products would be beneficial.

attributes.action: legally require a receipt to be printed only if a customer actually wants one
attributes.background: Many large companies automatically print receipts for customers after small transactions (namely fast food shops and brands offering a self service experience). Customers often do not take these receipts. This is an incredible waste of paper that is not justifiable and can be easily avoided.

attributes.action: Abolish the statutory fee that is charged when you collect your stolen vehicle.
attributes.background: Whenever a stolen vehicle is recovered by the police, you must pay a statutory fee to get your vehicle back.  If you refuse to pay, your vehicle will after 14 days be confiscated permanently and either sold or scrapped i.e. stolen from you again.  The fee increases daily.  It is unjust and unfair.

attributes.action: Ban strobe lighting to reduce the risks of epileptic seizures.
attributes.background: So many people are forced to turn away, close their eyes or even have others to protect them. It also prevents us to do something that normal people can do e.g. concerts. By banning strobes we would be reducing the risks of seizures and enable us to do something that anyone else could do.
attributes.additional_details: Being an epileptic myself, I know how it feels when we're unable to do something with friends or family, to describe it in anyway possible you feel alone. I would love to be able to do specific things such as concerts or horror mazes without having to wear sunglasses or close my eyes. If a seizure does occur in someone because of strobe lighting it can be fatal (SUDEP) to reduce this risk would be a major step forward. Many kinds of symptoms occur from epilepsy such as memory loss and depression.

attributes.action: Make all religious organisations give equal opportunities to men and women
attributes.background: Employment opportunities must be open to all without discrimination by law. The same must apply to all employment offered by religious organizations in Britain. The sex of the applicant must be made irrelevant.

attributes.action: Require weekly nature protection classes in schools
attributes.background: I graduated the theoretical high school Stefan Banulescu in Romania. The high school at that time  owned the GREEN FLAG provided by the European Inspectors who mattered with that high school.
attributes.additional_details: I would like environmental protection classes aim at cleaning parks, gardening, proper care of plants and animals. Excursions to the zoo, proximity to the natural environment that is existential to be saved, and many other innovative things that can be brought into discussion in some projects.

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Public investigation into treatment of people with autism/learning difficulties
attributes.background: Call on the government to investigate and reform the law so that the rights of parents, guardians or next of kin of people with autism/learning difficulties cannot be removed. Re: https://news.sky.com/story/40-people-died-in-barbaric-secure-hospitals-the-government-pledged-would-close-11540038
attributes.additional_details: It is in the general public’s best interest an investigation is carried out into the circumstances of the loss of life of people with a profound learning disability or autism who have died while admitted to secure hospitals or care homes over the last 40 yrs. Currently more than 2000 people are in assessment and treatment units with an average stay of more than 5 ½ years when they are supposed to be discharged within 18 months and their families do not have any right in deciding their treatment

attributes.action: Make it illegal for under 16's to have internet access on their mobile phones!
attributes.background: Children exposed to pornography at 9, cyber bullying see evidence link. Teenagers committing suicide because of cyber bullying, outrageous! They need constant supervision with the internet! It is far too dangerous and the safety of our children is the most important. It goes beyond parents control.
attributes.additional_details:
https://foreverymom.com/mom-gold/horror-stories-real-dont-give-children-smartphone-jonathon-van-maren/

I will give my daughter a cell phone when she is in year 6 and practising getting to school on her own ready for high school, but it will not have access to the internet, thats not going to stop other children who do have internet access from showing her inappropriate pictures or posting things about her though is it! For this to stop it needs to be illegal. They do not need internet access!

attributes.action: Change House of Commons rules so MPs can call each other by their names
attributes.background: Enough is enough, we the people demand this reform in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring on porn sites
attributes.background:
The government plans to add age verification and censoring on porn sites. 

We believe this is censorship via a back door.

We believe this will mean the UK will block many sites (just like China does).
attributes.additional_details:
It will increase pirated and probably illegal porn as it will end up only the criminals supplying porn.

We see each day sites hacked and data leaked, so we fear peoples details will be leaked online.

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Impose mandatory funeral funding clause upon private pension providers.
attributes.background: When my partner's father passed on, his family struggled to pay the cost of his funeral, in spite of not applying for the funeral funding payout from the job centre, which they were eligible for. We see non-UK nationals work lifelong, only to see their families impoverished by the cost of funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Families of nationals and non-UK nationals that provide an excellent service to the country are often left in a position where they cannot apply for state funeral funding because of the UK benefits system and its applications toward specific situations. Time of death cannot be predicted but private pension pay-ins are lifelong and should fund a funeral, which is the most costly part of some people's lives. The saddest day of one's life should never also be the most internally destructive.

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Increase the standard fine and points for driving in closed motorway lanes.
attributes.background: Despite radio ads, we still often see drivers waiting til the very last second to move out of closed lanes with a red X, often passing through a mile or so of warnings. Those caught in the accident and the police/ambulance service are put at risk by the idiocy of people in a hurry.
attributes.additional_details:
The current fines are either not charged, or aren't an adequate deterrent for vehicle users to not use them. Suggested alternatives - as the Highways Authority are informed of where an accident may be and which lanes to close, suggest turning on any cameras available to catch people. The cameras only need be turned on when the lane is closed.

If caught, increase the fine to £150 and 6 penalty points. Alternatively, for each gantry driven through with a red X give them the standard fine.

attributes.action: Create an ombudsman for the travel industry
attributes.background: At the moment when a person has a complaint regarding the travel industry the only person they can complain to is the travel member or ABTA. If there was an ombudsman appointed then the customer would stand a better chance of being helped by someone who is independent.

attributes.action: Mental health checkups should be completed yearly from a young age on the NHS
attributes.background: Mental health checkups through the NHS should be followed out just as physical health checks are done yearly from a young age.
